Detailed Description

Select the next microcode word to execute.

The microcode_branch module is responsible for selecting the next microcode word to execute. This decision is based on the value of the current microcode word, the value of the interrupt privilege level, the state of the current bus cycle and other internal signals.

The microcode_branch module implements a simple stack for the microcode addresses. This makes it possible to call subroutines inside the microcode.

Definition at line 3321 of file ao68000.v.

Definition at line 3403 of file ao68000.v.

 
03403 always @(posedge clock or negedge reset_n) begin
03404     if(reset_n == 1'b0) micro_pc_0 <= 9'd0;
03405     else                micro_pc_0 <= micro_pc;
03406 end
[Always Construct]
ALWAYS_32 ( clock ,
reset_n )

Definition at line 3408 of file ao68000.v.

 
03408 always @(posedge clock or negedge reset_n) begin
03409     if(reset_n == 1'b0) begin
03410         micro_pc_1 <= 9'd0;
03411         micro_pc_2 <= 9'd0;
03412         micro_pc_3 <= 9'd0;
03413     end
03414     else if(branch_control == `BRANCH_stop_flag_wait_ir_decode && prefetch_ir_valid == 1'b1 && decoder_trap == 8'd0)
03415     begin
03416         micro_pc_1 <= micro_pc_0 + { 5'd0, branch_offset };
03417         micro_pc_2 <= micro_pc_1;
03418         micro_pc_3 <= micro_pc_2;
03419     end
03420     else if(branch_control == `BRANCH_procedure) begin
03421         if(branch_offset == `PROCEDURE_call_read && load_ea != 9'd0) begin
03422             micro_pc_1 <= perform_ea_read;
03423             micro_pc_2 <= micro_pc_0 + 9'd1;
03424             micro_pc_3 <= micro_pc_1;
03425         end
03426         else if(branch_offset == `PROCEDURE_call_read && load_ea == 9'd0) begin
03427             micro_pc_1 <= micro_pc_0 + 9'd1;
03428             micro_pc_2 <= micro_pc_1;
03429             micro_pc_3 <= micro_pc_2;
03430         end
03431         else if(branch_offset == `PROCEDURE_call_write && save_ea != 9'd0) begin
03432             micro_pc_1 <= save_ea;
03433             micro_pc_2 <= micro_pc_1;
03434             micro_pc_3 <= micro_pc_2;
03435         end
03436         else if((branch_offset == `PROCEDURE_call_load_ea && load_ea != 9'd0) ||
03437                 (branch_offset == `PROCEDURE_call_perform_ea_read) ||
03438                 (branch_offset == `PROCEDURE_call_perform_ea_write) ||
03439                 (branch_offset == `PROCEDURE_call_save_ea && save_ea != 9'd0) ||
03440                 (branch_offset == `PROCEDURE_call_trap) )
03441         begin
03442             micro_pc_1 <= micro_pc_0 + 9'd1;
03443             micro_pc_2 <= micro_pc_1;
03444             micro_pc_3 <= micro_pc_2;
03445         end
03446         else if(branch_offset == `PROCEDURE_return) begin
03447             micro_pc_1 <= micro_pc_2;
03448             micro_pc_2 <= micro_pc_3;
03449             micro_pc_3 <= 9'd0;
03450         end
03451         else if(branch_offset == `PROCEDURE_push_micropc) begin
03452             micro_pc_1 <= micro_pc_0;
03453             micro_pc_2 <= micro_pc_1;
03454             micro_pc_3 <= micro_pc_2;
03455         end
03456         else if(branch_offset == `PROCEDURE_pop_micropc) begin
03457             micro_pc_1 <= micro_pc_2;
03458             micro_pc_2 <= micro_pc_3;
03459             micro_pc_3 <= 9'd0;
03460         end
03461     end
03462 end
